definition: camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for
private business/opposite: state-owned enterprise 國有企業|国有企业[guo2 you3 qi3 ye4]

sentences.english: The resources of the private sector will also be harnessed by incentivising training through an outcome - based approach.
sentences.chinese: 私营部门的资源也要通过培训的收入被激励和利用。

sentences.english: Suntory is a private, family-run firm.
sentences.chinese: 而三得利是一家私营的，家族经营的公司。

sentences.english: As has been the case before, the military can be a trailblazer for the private sector.
sentences.chinese: 跟以往一样，美军可为私营企业开创道路。

sentences.english: "I've decided to keep my privates private, " he writes.
sentences.chinese: “我已经决定让我的士兵私营，”他写道。

sentences.english: He has more than 38 years of working experience in the public and private sectors of the construction industry.
sentences.chinese: 王书燐于公营及私营建筑业界拥有超过38年经验。

sentences.english: You have to depend on a free market, you have to depend on the market forces, you have to depend on the financial system which is also private sector based.
sentences.chinese: 你必须依靠市场，依靠以私营经济为基础的金融体系。

sentences.english: Last month there were over a thousand bankruptcies in the private sector.
sentences.chinese: 上个月有上千个私营企业破产。

sentences.english: He added that the private sector should be encouraged to contribute.
sentences.chinese: 他补充到，其中将包括鼓励私营部门作出贡献。

sentences.english: In 1998, the enterprise was reformed into a private-owned enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 一九九八年改制为私营企业。

sentences.english: It has less bureaucracy and, hence, lower administrative costs than private insurers.
sentences.chinese: 与私营保险比较，这项计划官僚程序少，行政成本低。

sentences.english: Private entrepreneurships were introduced and many countryside villagers were moving to the cities to earn money.
sentences.chinese: 私营企业被引入，许多农村居民涌向城市去淘金。

sentences.english: This Forum is centred on the theme of co-operation between public and private housing and their prospect for the future.
sentences.chinese: 此论坛取题于公营与私营房屋合作的现况和开拓前景。

sentences.english: In addition to its lending, the government is showering money on the private sector through direct spending.
sentences.chinese: 除放贷外，政府还通过直接支出向私营经济大笔散钱。

sentences.english: only about 7 percent of private workers are unionized.
sentences.chinese: 只有约7%的私营部门雇员加入工会。
私营部门的就业增长大幅减缓。

sentences.english: For example, Metro Manila's water supply is now managed by two private sector concessionaires .
sentences.chinese: 例如，马尼拉供水目前所管理的两个私营部门的特许。

definition: privately run (i.e. by a company, not the state)
private business/opposite: state-owned enterprise 國有企業|国有企业[guo2 you3 qi3 ye4]
government (viewed as an organization)/institutions of government/government office
public enterprise, as opposed to private enterprise 私營企業|私营企业[si1 ying2 qi3 ye4]
